metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0198 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Dnsmasq before 2.66test2, when used with certain libvirt configurations, replies to queries from prohibited interfaces, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (traffic amplification) via spoofed TCP based DNS queries. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-3411.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.65-1ubuntu1
dnsmasq-base - 2.65-1ubuntu1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.65-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> may introduce changes in behaviour, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/dnsmasq/+bug/1126488 we will not be fixing this in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, users in environments where this issue is problematic are recommended to upgrade to a more recent LTS release.

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.65-1ubuntu1').
